subject: Proposal for a new font
msgSnippet: Hi all, I was thinking about a new Quickscript font, one which is perhaps easier to read. Whether this is the case remains to be seen, as the font doesn t
messageBody:
Hi all,

I was thinking about a new Quickscript font, one which is perhaps easier
to read. Whether this is the case remains to be seen, as the font doesn't
exist yet :)

Attached you will find an image about what I want to do. It doesn't look
too good but I can't seem to get my scanner to work :(

Anyway, what I want is a monospaced Quickscript font. Characters should be
wider and with big, obvious loops. Even characters such as y and Y should
be made a bit different (see the attached file) to increase legibility.

There are still a few problems: What to do about the three thin letters:
i, I and t?

Shall we ignore them (make everything monospaced except for these three)
or shall we add serifs? (see attached picture).

What will perhaps also increase legibility is continuous line width of the
letters, which is the case now in the Kingsley font.

Ewout

Hi all,

I was thinking about a new Quickscript font, one which is perhaps easier
to read. Whether this is the case remains to be seen, as the font doesn't
exist yet :)

Attached you will find an image about what I want to do. It doesn't look
too good but I can't seem to get my scanner to work :(

Anyway, what I want is a monospaced Quickscript font. Characters should be
wider and with big, obvious loops. Even characters such as y and Y should
be made a bit different (see the attached file) to increase legibility.

There are still a few problems: What to do about the three thin letters:
i, I and t?

Shall we ignore them (make everything monospaced except for these three)
or shall we add serifs? (see attached picture).

What will perhaps also increase legibility is continuous line width of the
letters, which is the case now in the Kingsley font.

Ewout
